A database is a software system that manages the storage, organization, and retrieval of data in a structured format, allowing for efficient storage, retrieval, and manipulation of that data. Shared memory is a type of parallel architecture where multiple processors share a common physical memory, allowing for faster communication and data sharing between processors. ## PDF REFERENCE Source: /Users/gmcjy/Documents/Backup/test/DB-architecture.pdf Page: 28 :pencil: :greenPage Content: tectures,a shared-nothing cluster is often made up of many nodes each of whichis a shared-memory multi-processors.
Different types of database parallel architecture?

The three main types of parallel database architectures are shared-memory, shared-disk, and shared-nothing. The choice of architecture depends on the specific needs of the application. ## PDF REFERENCE Source: /Users/gmcjy/Documents/Backup/test/DB-architecture.pdf Page: 27 :pencil: :greenPage Content: 168 Parallel Architecture: Processes and Memory Coordination requests, accessing necessary metadata, compiling SQL requests, and performing data access just as on a single shared memory system asdescribed above. The main diﬀerence is that each system in the clusterstores only a portion of the data. Rather than running the queries theyreceive against their local data only, the requests are sent to othermembers of the cluster and all machines involved execute the query inparallel against the data
